title: Mutli-image USB bootable wish list and terminology.

forumNotes.author: Innomen
forumNotes.content:
Firstly, pardon if this is improper in some way. My search fu is weak.  

Secondly, hi all :smile:  

And finally. My question.  

I would like an application that can accomplish the following.  

Format a USB to be bootable. Resulting USB has a folder for images that when the USB is booted from lists the isos in said folder and allows me to choose which one to boot from. Much like xboot, however...  

Here are the restrictions.  
I want it to attempt to do this with any iso, I do not want to have to identify it beforehand. (like how do I know if I need to pick grub for dos or syslinux? Both seem to work for the isos I've chosen.)  

I do not want to have to know what combination of isos I'll select beforehand, as with xboot and the like.  

It's nice being able to make a key that will boot from a menu of isos, but it sucks to have to completely remake the key if I want to add or remove isos, or having to add or remove isos, with the app. I would prefer it to populate a dynamic list based on the contents of an images folder.  

Does a tool that meets these requirements exist? If not, is there some reason beyond no one feeling the need to write it, like some technical reason that completely precludes it? I'd like to hear it if so, even if I won't understand it, just out of curiosity.  

In terms of future searches what are these mechanics called from a community standard perspective? Like what should I have used as tags for this post for instance?  

Thank you for your time and patience. :smile:

forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content:
It is currently hard, read impossible, to create such **software** application, simply because between each ISO there is a difference and a different workaround is needed.  
2000/XP/2003 ISO needs one addition. Vista/7/8/Server 2008 second. Ubuntu- third. Fedora- fourth, and so on and so on.  
There is no universal workaround for booting just any ISO from USB disk this way. Until ISO booting from USB is standardised, which probably may never happen given the fact this requires all developers involved to take ISO booting into account.  

You better off have a look at a hardware solution, like [this one](http://reboot.pro/14006/ ""), [this one](http://www.i-odd.com/ "External link"), or with a little patience [this one](http://reboot.pro/15475/ "").  

You may also want to read this topic:  
<http://reboot.pro/8944/>

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
What you want can be done by using grub4dos and a large menu.lst file (or split in into smaller ones with sub-menus).  

The new **iftitle** menu command in grub4dos means that all the end user has to do is drop the correct file (with correct file name) onto the USB drive (correct folder) and it will automatically appear in the grub4dos menu on next boot.  

Of course, what you need to do is prepare grub4dos menu files which have menu entries for all the ISOs ever released over the last 10 years and all IMG and IMA files and other types of bootable images that the user might possibly want, and then test it on every possible type of PC/notebook/netbook in the world. ![:loleverybody:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/loleverybody.gif)
